1.text: Use a mix of russet and Yukon Gold potatoes when making a new batch.

2.text: Cook the potatoes in simmering water to make them soft.

3.text: Mash the potatoes by hand to prevent them from becoming gummy.

4.text: Add cream and butter to the potatoes after they’re at room temperature.

5.text: Mix the new mashed potatoes into the gluey batch to even out the texture.

7.text: Smooth the gluey potatoes in a thin layer across an oven-safe casserole dish.

8.text: Sprinkle some bread crumbs over the dish to add some flavor.

9.text: Cover the mashed potatoes in a thin layer of cheese.

10.text: Top the potatoes evenly with ¼ cup (55 g) of butter.

11.text: Bake the dish for at least 10-15 minutes, or until the top is golden-brown.
